column4: if I want to upgrade to the latest stable release of ubuntu, is it 'apt-get install dist-upgrade'?  do I have to change the lines in my sources.list that all say 'dapper' ?
No!  *Don't* do that, you'll almost certainly break something.
Note that you *have* to upgrade through Edgy.
so I have to upgrade to edgy, then to feisty?
Yes.  Basically, you just have to run "update-manager" twice :)
how can I confirm that I am running 6.06?
ah, thanks..  one last question..  is there a non-gui version of update-manager?  I'm doing this over SSH
I don't think so.  Also, trying to upgrade your stuff over SSH is a recipie for misery :)
I have remote console access, in case SSH fails
You mean, you can go an physically get to the machine?
no I don't have physical access to the machine. but the hosting provider provides remote console access, in case you mess up your firewall or lock yourself out someone..  it's an AJAX terminal
What about if your Dapper->Edgy or Edgy->Feisty upgrade results in your network connection being broken?
the remote console doesn't rely on the host's internet connection..  the remote console sits on a seperate server, and connects as a terminal.  just like a console
I don't *think* there's a CLI version of the update-manager, but you could just use X forwarding?
yeah, I will try x-forwarding..  not ideal but ok :)
